message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the adaptations of polar bears. Polar bears have thick, wooly fur that helps them thrive in their cold, Arctic environment. The fur provides insulation and helps them retain body heat, enabling them to withstand the extreme cold temperatures. Option (A) is incorrect because the purpose of the fur is not to become a mop. Option (B) is subjective and does not reflect the biological reason for the fur. Option (C) is incorrect because the fur does not have a cleaning purpose, but rather an insulating one.
